rsyncInstall: Install: sudo apt-get install rsync (Ubuntu/Debian) or sudo yum install rsync (CentOS/RHEL)
inotifyRecommended: 2. inotify-tools (Recommended - for real-time file change detection)
inotifyInstall: Install: sudo apt-get install inotify-tools (Ubuntu/Debian) or sudo yum install inotify-tools (CentOS/RHEL)
howItWorksDesc: This tool monitors file changes in the source directory and automatically synchronizes them to the destination. When you modify, add, or delete files in the source directory, the changes are immediately synced to the destination.
localToRemoteDesc: Local→Remote: Monitors your local directory and syncs changes to the remote server. Useful for pushing code changes to a development server.
remoteToLocalDesc: Remote→Local: Monitors the remote directory and syncs changes to your local machine. Useful for pulling logs or data from a server.
rsyncUsage: The tool uses rsync for file transfer, which is efficient and only transfers the changed parts of files.
inotifyUsage: inotify-tools (specifically inotifywait) is used to watch for file system events in real-time, enabling instant synchronization.
fallbackMode: If inotify-tools is not available, the tool falls back to periodic polling (checking for changes every few seconds), which is less efficient but still functional.
helpIntro: For optimal sync performance, install these packages on your remote server. The sync feature will still work without them (using SFTP fallback and polling), but performance and real-time detection will be degraded.
rsyncDescription: Without rsync, sync uses SFTP which transfers whole files instead of incremental diffs.
rsyncInstallCommands:
# Ubuntu / Debian
sudo apt-get install rsync

# CentOS / RHEL / Fedora
sudo yum install rsync
# or
sudo dnf install rsync

# Alpine
apk add rsync

# macOS (usually pre-installed)
brew install rsync
inotifyDescription: Without inotifywait, the sync uses periodic polling (every 5 seconds) to detect changes.
inotifyInstallCommands:
# Ubuntu / Debian
sudo apt-get install inotify-tools

# CentOS / RHEL / Fedora
sudo yum install inotify-tools
# or
sudo dnf install inotify-tools

# Alpine
apk add inotify-tools
withRsync: With rsync: Uses rsync over SSH for efficient incremental sync (only changed bytes are transferred)
withoutRsync: Without rsync: Falls back to SFTP-based sync (compares file size/mtime, transfers entire changed files)
withInotify: With inotifywait: Real-time file change detection on remote server
withoutInotify: Without inotifywait: Polls remote directory every 5 seconds for changes
localChanges: Local changes: Always detected in real-time using OS-native file watching (fsnotify)
syncDirectionDescription: The Source side always wins in case of conflicts. If you set Source = Local, your local directory is the "truth" and remote will be overwritten to match it.
